Description: Ostracon, fragment of the rim of a fine buff-coloured pottery bowl with flaring sides and turned rim, both interior and exterior covered with an orange-red burnished slip, with remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the interior and another line on the exterior, containing a table of fractions.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.56-57)
Hasitzka 1990 / Neue Texte und Dokumentation zum Koptisch-Unterricht (p.267)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (89513) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/89513)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Rain.UnterrichtKopt. 325 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 27 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
